Error handling

Source: R/eval_handle.R
handle_errors.Rd

Some errors may lock up the console for much longer than they should. This can often be because R has difficulty figuring out the callstack to generate the error message. This function is a simple wrapper to set up a tryCatch evaluation that will return all enclosed errors with the stop() arg call. = FALSE setting.

Usage

handle_errors(expr, prefix = "")

Arguments

expr

expression to evaluate

prefix

string. An optional prefix to add before the error to help report where it was from.

Value

Throws an error without processing stop calls.

Examples

x <- function() {
    handle_errors(stop("this is an error"))
}
if (FALSE) {
    x()
}

y <- function() {
    handle_errors(
        stop("this is an error"),
        prefix = "error location:"
    )
}
if (FALSE) {
    y()
}
